goal: Establish a small productive garden and chicken area to provide fresh vegetables, herbs, and eggs for the family.

materials.name: Garden tools (spade, hoe, rake, watering can)

steps.title: Select Garden and Chicken Area
steps.description: Choose sunny, level ground near water source. Keep chicken area downwind of tents.

steps.title: Prepare Garden Beds
steps.description: Mark garden plots. Loosen soil using spade or hoe. Mix in compost to improve fertility.

steps.title: Plant Seeds and Herbs
steps.description: Plant quick-growing vegetables (lettuce, radish, spinach) and herbs (basil, parsley, coriander). Follow spacing instructions on seed packets.

steps.title: Build Chicken Coop
steps.description: Assemble coop according to plans. Ensure secure doors and windows with mesh. Include nesting boxes for hens.

steps.title: Install Water and Feed Stations
steps.description: Place water troughs and feeders inside coop. Refill daily. Ensure no contamination of water.

steps.title: Fence Chicken & Garden Areas
steps.description: Install netting around garden to protect from chickens and wildlife. Keep chickens within coop/pen area during night.

steps.title: Introduce Hens
steps.description: Bring hens into the coop. Allow them to explore pen area gradually. Monitor for signs of stress or illness.

steps.title: Watering and Maintenance
steps.description: Water garden daily or every second day depending on rainfall. Rotate chicken bedding weekly, collect eggs daily.

steps.title: Harvesting
steps.description: Begin harvesting quick-growing crops after 3â€“4 weeks. Collect eggs daily and rotate feed for hens.

safety: Wear gloves when handling soil, compost, or manure.
Ensure chickens are securely enclosed at night to prevent predation.
Keep feed dry to prevent mold.
Wash hands after handling eggs or chickens.
